rules.rule1: üìç Minimum team count should be 3.
rules.rule2: üìç The winning team's IGL must report the match result to the admins after the match.
rules.rule3: üìç In the event of your opponent failing to make contact or refusing to play the match, please contact the admins immediately for assistance.
rules.rule4: üìç Both team IGL are encouraged to mutually agree on a map for the match.
rules.rule5: üìç The winning team's captain must report the match result to the admins before 11:00 PM of the match days.

posts.title: e-Football
posts.content: e-Football Tournament
posts.description: Get ready to kick off the ultimate virtual showdown in the eFootball Tournament at Yukthi '24. Unleash your digital skills, strategize your plays, and compete for glory. It's not just a game; it's a high-stakes battle for e-soccer supremacy!

rules.rule1: üìç Registered players are allotted to each group.
rules.rule2: üìç Logo of the base team allotted should be used by the players throughout the tournament. The players will be identified by their game id, name and team crest.
rules.rule3: üìç eFootball in Yukthi ‚Äò24 follows group and knockout stage format where each team in the group will play each other in round robin format. There will be no home and away format.
rules.rule4: üìç The club who wins in the finals will be crowned Yukthi ‚Äò24 eFootball champion
rules.rule6: üìç No extra time and penalties in the group stage matches.
rules.rule7: üìç Team strength unlimited, any type of cards can be used.
rules.rule8: üìçConditions of the players have to be set as Random.
rules.rule9: üìç If there are any network issues in the first half, a new match has to be played from the start with the aggregate score of the disconnected match.
rules.rule10: üìç If there are any network issues in the second half, a new match has to be played with the aggregate score of the disconnected match only till the HalfTime.
rules.rule11: üìç Screenshot of the results has to be put showing the stats of the match by both teams.
rules.rule12: üìç If a player is unable to play a match, the opponent will get a walkover win of 3 - 0, but these goals will not be added to the goal scoring sheet.
rules.rule13: üìç If a player faces any kind of issues during the tournament, the player has to inform the Admins with¬†solid¬†proof.

posts.title: Free Fire
posts.content: Embrace the sizzle of intense battles
posts.description: Join the ranks of contenders as you navigate the fiery battlegrounds, where every move counts.üî´üí• Victory flickers on the horizon ‚Äì the question beckons, are you prepared to turn up the heat and emerge as the true FreeFire champion‚ùî

rules.rule1: üìç A player should only register as a part of a single team.
rules.rule2: üìç Teams that attempt to use players which are not registered in their team may be disqualified.
rules.rule3: üìç All players must remain in the game‚Äôs lobby following the conclusion of each match. This allows us to view their final score on the scoreboard.
rules.rule4: üìç Players that leave the lobby earlier and thus do not show up on the scoreboard may be suspended from on-going tournaments.
rules.rule5: üìç Once the match has started, only the players that are in the lobby are eligible to play. In the case of a player disconnecting and is not able to join back, a team is allowed to have a registered player on their team to substitute. This is allowed only once.
rules.rule6: üìç It is not allowed to switch to the spectator mode. If a player is caught using the spectator mode, that team will automatically have to forfeit the current round of that match.
rules.rule7: üìç Abusing in-game glitches or bugs that give a team an unfair advantage is not permitted. Teams caught doing so may be disqualified.
rules.rule8: üìç The usage of ‚Äòjailbroken‚Äô or ‚Äòrooted‚Äô devices in tournament matches is not permitted.
rules.rule9: üìç Use of emulators or controllers is prohibited.
rules.rule10: üìç Do not join an official tournament lobby if you are not part of the team that is playing. Ineligible players that do join are at risk of being banned from the tournament or receive other penalties.
rules.rule11: üìç All teams are required to properly go through the tournament rules, regulations and guidelines and contact the representatives to clear any queries.
rules.rule12: üìç By participating in our tournaments, all participants automatically agree that they vow to respect fellow participants and organizers.
rules.rule13: üìç If any more rules apply, then they may be found in the tournament‚Äôs registration¬†article.

posts.title: Battlegrounds Mobile
posts.content: Battlegrounds Mobile India
posts.description: Battlegrounds Mobile India (BGMI) is an online multiplayer battle royale game where up to 100 players compete to be the last one standing. It requires skill, strategy, and teamwork to survive and win. Join the fun and excitement of BGMI with amazing rewards, events, and celebrity guests. Are you ready to enter the battlegrounds and claim your glory? Hit that register button now!

posts.title: Spanathon
posts.content: Learn how to design and build strong and stable bridges with this Bridge making workshop! üåâ
posts.description: Join us for a comprehensive and hands-on workshop that will teach you the basics and skills of bridge engineering. You will learn about the different types of bridges, such as arch, beam, truss, suspension, and cable-stayed bridges, and how they transfer loads and resist forces. You will also design and fabricate your own bridge model using various materials and test its strength and efficiency. You will also discover the real-world applications and challenges of bridge engineering in various domains and sectors.

rules.rule1: üíé Unmoulded moulds will be given in the spot.
rules.rule2: üíé Participants should  set up them.
rules.rule3: üíé Only  provided equipments are allowed to use.
rules.rule4: üíé Only individual participation is allowed.
rules.rule6: üíé Moulds should be tightened within the specified time.
rules.rule7: üíé Any kind of malpractices will be lead to direct disqualification.

posts.title: Capture the Flag
posts.content: Test your hacking skills and challenge yourself with this CTF competition! üèÅ
posts.description: Join us for a thrilling and competitive CTF competition that will put your cybersecurity knowledge and abilities to the test. You will face a series of challenges across multiple categories, such as web, crypto, reversing, forensics, and more. You will have to find hidden flags, which are strings of text or digital artifacts, within the given challenges. The team or individual with the most points at the end of the competition wins the prize and the glory.

rules.rule1: 1. Contestants can use their personal laptops otherwise one shall be provided by the college
rules.rule2: 2. Should have a strong internet connection as the competition was taken on a speed typing website
rules.rule3: 3. You will be given a copy of the content to be typed
rules.rule4: 4. All the rules are based on the number of participating participants and can be changed if participants are less
rules.rule5: 5. The time, content and threshold for the first round will be revealed during the event

posts.title: Blind Programming
posts.content: Show off your coding skills and confidence with this blind programming competition! üôà
posts.description: Join us for a challenging and fun competition that will test your coding abilities without a problem statement. You will be given a piece of code that may contain errors or bugs that you need to fix in order to make it work correctly. You will also have to figure out the input and output formats, the logic, and the expected output of the code. The team or individual with the most correct and efficient solutions wins the prize and the bragging rights.

posts.content: Are you ready to hunt for the hidden clues and secrets on the web? Join Web Hunt today! üïµÔ∏è

You will have to follow a trail of clues, puzzles, and riddles across various websites and platforms, such as blogs, social media, forums, and more. You will have to find hidden codes, passwords, or messages within the given challenges. The team or individual with the most points at the end of the competition wins the prize and the glory.

posts.description: Join us for a challenging and rewarding competition that will test your programming skills and knowledge. You will face a series of problems across multiple domains and languages, such as web, data structures, algorithms, databases, and more. You will have to write efficient, elegant, and bug-free code that passes all the test cases and meets the specifications. The team or individual with the highest score at the end of the competition wins the prize and the recognition.

posts.title: SegFault - Treasure Hunt
posts.content: Where in the world does Friday come before Thursday?
posts.description: Piece the clues together and solve coding challenges in the SegFault treasure hunt organised by the FOSS Club. Get a chance to showcase your problem solving skills and unleash your inner Sherlock Holmes by cracking the code!

rules.rule1: üìç Teams of 3 (no more, no less) can participate
rules.rule2: üìç The event contains 5 levels (levels 0 to 4), with a clue or a challenge leading to the next level
rules.rule3: üìç The event is 2 hours, and if no teams complete the event on time, the winning teams will be decided by the jury
rules.rule4: üìç Mobile phones with internet is allowed for all members of the team
rules.rule5: üìç Clues or challenges includes physical or virtual ones, such as clues on paper or shell scripting on lab computer
rules.rule6: üìç Searching the web or consulting documentation to finish the challenges are encouraged
rules.rule7: üìç All teams will start at level 0 and level-up until they reach level 4 based on how they interpret the given clues or based on their performance in the given challenge
rules.rule8: üìç When three teams reach level 3, or if exactly one hour is over, all the teams which have not reached level 3 yet will be disqualified
rules.rule9: üìç Level 4 (the final level) will consist of a challenge, and the team which completes the challenge first will be declared the winners. The team which completes the challange second will be declared the runners up.
